Summarised Review: ujjain is the place to visit for the devotees of lord Shiva . Mahakal is the main highlight of the place .
one of the 18 shakthipeeths, a must visit temple . best time to visit the temple is in evening during Aarti time around 7pm .
first time in my life I saw liquor being offered to God in the temple . flowers can also be offered . very popular among pilgrims and tourists and believed to be live .
the Gurukul housed in Sandipani Muni ashram is famous because Lord Krishna with his brother Balram studied different Vidyas here .

ISKON is a international organisation devoted for worship of Lord Krishna . the temple houses the idols of Radha Madhana Mohan, Sri Krishna Balram and Sri Gauri Nitai dressed in vibrantly coloured dresses and beautiful jewelers .
the idol in the temple of Gadkalika, is supposed to have been worshipped by Kalidasa . the temple is considered as one of the Shati peethas and famous among tourists .
chintaman temple is a temple of god ganesha . entrance of temple is very narrow but despite of that there was a very long line of people to pray .
the Ram Ghat is one of the biggest pilgrim places in india . by the side of river Shipra , a sacred place where Hindus do believe Raja Ram performed the last rites of his father Dasharath.
beautiful temple of Lord Ganesha in a big statue , it's very near to the Mahakaleshwar temple .
gopal mandir is a beautiful,clean and good architecture temple . the main door entrance believed to have been originally in the somnath temple which was looted by Mohamed of Gazni .
the hotel rates were exorbitantly high during the kumbh, something like 7000/night whereas its 1000 during normal days . the place was too crowded but good arrangements were done .
the temple is famous for all nine grah gods . it is situated on triveni ghat on the banks of river shipra .
the caves was supposed to have been inhabited by Bhartrihari some 2000 years ago . there are few steps to go down but the cave it self is very small .
the place is a memorial and worship place devoted to the king vikramaditya . a brass made statue of king vikramaditya is the centre attraction . there is also a big sculpture of her 32 maharanis .
jantar mantar is located on the bank of river kshipra in ujjain . the observatory provides information about how decide time in ancient time .
siddhavat tree is a huge banyan tree and people came here for pooja and havans . one can spend hours here in meditation and pray and relux .
there are nine temples of bhairavars in nine different forms scattered around the city . devotees offer liquor to lord as a offering .

chaar dham is a 15 year old temple situated at the back side of mahakaleshwar temple . apart from temple there is small spiritual exhibition is also there which you can visit by paying a nominal ticket fee .
Located within the compound of Shri Mahakal Bhakta Nivas, this is without doubt the most beautiful temple dedicated to mother India .
the academy is dedicated to the work of Great Kalidas . every year there is kalidas national festival - plays are performed by various cultural groups across india .
gomti kund is located at the outskirts of ujjain . it is believed that you actually feel stress free when you visit this place .
one of several temples along the shipra river ram ghat also a sightseeing place in ujjain . the 100 year old temple was reconstructed in the year 1974 .
this is one of the oldest temples in ujjain with 24 pillers . near the northern side of the entrance are two small temples dedicated to Mahalaya and Mahamaya goddess .
Vikram University dedicated to King Vikramaditya is one of the first universities to have been established after independence in 1957 . the university offers a wide range of graduation courses .
vikram kirti mandir museum tells about the history of the ujjain . it is a govt auditorium where lots of cultural events and activities has been organized .
Ranmukteshwar Temple is located very near from the main ujjain city . the temple is built under a banyan tree, more than 100 years old .
i am born and brought up in ujjain... we have been visiting this temple every sunday . Located near the Harsiddhi Mata temple it is a relatively new temple dedicated to king Vikramaditya .
this temple is one of the temple of goddess dhumAvati . there always some feast (bhandara) aur Anushthaan happening almost every day .
this temple situated right on the Ram Ghat is hardly visited . Radha Madan Mohan temple is so beautiful that you won't feel like returning home .
the palace is built over a mound and gives a beautiful view of the surrounding area . there are 52 kunds in which there is no water .
the samadhi is decorated with flowers . its believed that he mastered 84 mahasiddhis (supernatural powers)
During navratri the temple is beautifully decorated and lots of people visit it . it is considered as the protected deity of the city .
this is one of the must visit temple in the city of ujjain dedicated to lord chitragupta . he has temples dedicated to him in some four cities in india . it is also a holy place .

an ecotourism park development with the help of MPEDB, BHOPAL with an objective to provide environmental spa to people near city . one can visit this area for mental calm, digital detox, calory burning and many more fun activities .
Shree Jagdish Mandir is located in kartik chowk in ujjain . it is a small temple for the worship of lord jagdish .
its a small garden located close to kothi palace in ujjain . where you find accupressure pathway and other excercise instruments . its well maintained and clean .
